definition: to chop/to cut down/to throw sth at sb
dry measure for grain equal to ten dou 斗/ten pecks/one hundred liters
surname Shi
rock/stone/stone inscription/one of the eight categories of ancient musical instruments 八音[ba1 yin1]
deficient/to owe/to lack/yawn
machete
to hew/to cut down
to bargain/to cut or beat down a price
to chop off
to attack with a bladed weapon
to decapitate/to behead
lit. sharpening the axe won't make the wood-splitting take longer (idiom)/fig. time invested in preparations is not lost/a beard well lathered is half shaved
pinyin: mo2 dao1 bu4 wu4 kan3 chai2 gong1

definition: to chat (1980s Beijing slang)/to chew the fat
wanton destruction of forested lands
to wound with a blade or hatchet/to slash/to gash
to chop wood/to chop down trees
to hack to death/to kill with an ax
to regard decapitation as no more important than the wind blowing off your hat (idiom)
pinyin: kan3 tou2 bu4 guo4 feng1 chui1 mao4

sentences.english: The man first cut the tree down and then cut it up.
sentences.chinese: 那人先把树砍，然后将其削减了。

sentences.english: Hunca Munca stood up in her chair, and chopped at the ham with another lead knife.
sentences.chinese: 亨卡忙卡从椅子上站起来，用另一把铅皮餐刀砍火腿。

sentences.english: Liu Mei discovered when suddenly want to back to chop wood field who drains.
sentences.chinese: 陆梅忽然想开初到砍木场时发现的阿谁下水口。

sentences.english: If not killing, wood should not be cut, wood where?
sentences.chinese: 若论不杀生，竹木不宜砍，柴薪何来？

sentences.english: Asa cut down her image, crushed it, and burned it at the brook Kidron.
sentences.chinese: 亚撒砍下他的偶像，捣得粉碎，烧在汲沦溪边。

sentences.english: He cut desperately at the rope in an attempt to free his foot.
sentences.chinese: 他拼命砍绳子，试图把自己的脚解脱开。

sentences.english: He slashed his way through the bush.
sentences.chinese: 他挥刀从草丛中砍出一条路来。

sentences.english: For every head you cut off, a new one grows back.
sentences.chinese: 你每砍下一颗头，都会长出一个新的来。

sentences.english: I ’ve seen a palace maid beheaded.
sentences.chinese: 我就见过一个宫女被砍了头。

sentences.english: They use an axe and disfigure the rhino's face.
sentences.chinese: 他们用斧头砍，把犀牛的脸都砍坏了。

sentences.english: You can bargain at the market and get a better price.
sentences.chinese: 你可以在市场上砍价，可以砍到一个好价钱。

sentences.english: You should've beaten him down to three pounds.
sentences.chinese: 你本来可以砍到三镑的。

sentences.english: The farmer spent a day in the woods hewing timber.
sentences.chinese: 这个农夫花了一天时间在森林里砍木材。

sentences.english: Go to the mountain, and bring back more firewood.
sentences.chinese: 你上山多砍一些柴薪来。

sentences.english: He chopped at me with his axe, but missed.
sentences.chinese: 他用斧向我砍来，但未砍中。

sentences.english: He chopped at me with his axe, but missed.
sentences.chinese: 他用斧向我砍来，但未砍中。

to split in two/to divide
ax/hatchet/CL:柄[bing3]
to behead (as form of capital punishment)/to chop
to chop off
to hack to death/to kill with an ax
knife/blade/single-edged sword/cutlass/CL:把[ba3]/(slang) dollar (loanword)/classifier for sets of one hundred sheets (of paper)/classifier for knife cuts or stabs
surname Dao
broadsword/large knife/machete
axe/hatchet/CL:把[ba3]
to swing (one's arms, a heavy object)/to wave (a sword, one's fists)/to fling (money)
to select
to attack with a bladed weapon
machete
hatchet
to cut/to cut apart
to chop up (meat etc)/to chop off (sb's hand etc)
to blow out/to blow off/(computer games) to zap/(phone) to ring off the hook/to be jammed/to max out (credit card etc)
to chop wood/to chop down trees
